verses.verse: An honorable name[b] is more to be desired than great riches, and high esteem is preferable to silver and gold.
The rich and the poor have this in common: all of them were made by the LORD.[c]
A prudent man perceives danger and seeks shelter, while the simple[d] continue forward and pay for it.
The reward of humility and fear of the LORD[e] is wealth, honor, and life.
Thorns and snares cover the path of the perverse; whoever values his life will steer clear of them.
Train a child in the way he should go, and he will not deviate from it, even in old age.
The wealthy man lords it over the poor,[f] and the borrower becomes the slave of the lender.
Whoever sows injustice will reap calamity, and the rod of his wrath will disappear.
One who is kindly will be blessed,[g] for he shares his food with the poor.
Banish the scoffer[h] and strife will cease; discord and abuse will come to an end.
The LORD loves the pure of heart; the man of gracious speech will have the king as a friend.
The eyes of the LORD[i] preserve knowledge, but he ruins the plans of the unfaithful.
The idler cries out, “There is a lion outside; I will be killed if I go out on the street.”[j]
The mouth of an adulteress[k] is a deep pit; the man with whom the LORD is angry will fall into it.
Folly is rooted deep in the heart of a child, but the rod of correction[l] will remove it far from him.
A man becomes rich by crushing the poor, but presents to the rich will only impoverish him.[m]
These are the sayings of the wise: Incline your ear and listen to my words, and apply your mind to the knowledge I impart.
They will afford pleasure if you keep them in your heart and have all of them ready on your lips.
In order that your trust may be in the LORD, I will make them known to you today.
Have I not written for you thirty sayings[p] of admonition and knowledge
to show you what is right and true so that you can offer sound answers to the one who sent you?
Do not rob the poor because they are helpless or oppress the needy at the gate.
For the LORD will take up their cause[r] and rob of life those who despoiled them.
Never make friends with a man prone to anger, and do not associate with anyone who is wrathful.
Otherwise you may learn his ways[s] and find yourself entangled in a snare.
Do not be one of those who give pledges and become surety for another’s debts.
For if you have no means of paying, your bed will be taken from under you.
Never remove the ancient boundary stone that your ancestors set up.
If you see a man who is skilled in his work,[t] remember that he will serve kings; he will not stand before common people.
